msContents.summary: Side 1: Contract for the lease of land. Side 2: Coptic papyrus of unknown specific content.

msItemStruct.note: Text is on both sides. Side 1: 3 lines written against the fibers, with top and left margin visible. Side 2: 7 lines written with the fibers, no margins visible.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Ellen W. Harrison Collection.

supportDesc.support: 9.7 x 6.7cm. Upper left corner of what was probably a land contract. The left margin is broken at several places, with the loss of only a few letters; a 3 cm. wide margin has been left at the upper side. The right and lower sides are broken. The writing is blurred at in several places.

provenance.p: Purchased from Professor Bernhard Moritz of Cairo through W.M. Mueller, 1910.

div.ab: Side 1: [In the name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate]... 1. [the witnesses mentioned in this deed bore witness that X, son of Y, Z, son of A], and Umm al-Haris acknowledge before them and called [them] as witnesses 2. [upon themselves, in the full health of their minds and bodies and in their capacity of transacting business, that they shared in the own]ership of the four faddans of the goo[d] land 3. [known as +/-35 ] belonging to that which was registered under the name of Muhammad, son of Yusuf, for three dinars and a half ...........
